line_1: On Fancy built, his airy Schemes
line_2: In vain the mad Fanatick's Dreams

line_1: Nor heaps of wealth, nor power, nor statesman's schemes,
line_2: Nor all deceiv'd Ambition's feverish dreams,

line_1: Ye prime in state display your deepest schemes;
line_2: And, ye nice wits, your fancy-forming dreams;

line_1: A sense of honour would destroy his schemes,
line_2: And conscience ne'er must speak unless in dreams.

line_1: See Providence defeating all your Schemes:
line_2: See how delusive are Ambition's Dreams,

line_1: And Macer with his no less airy schemes;
line_2: When Flavia entertains us with her dreams,

line_1: Then farewell all self-satisfying schemes,
line_2: His well-built systems, philosophic dreams,

line_1: The doubtful sages search their heav'nly schemes:
line_2: The prince with anxious looks relates his dreams,

line_1: Why would you mock my woe with airy schemes,
line_2: (He fainting said) of gay fantastick dreams?

line_1: "Zeno's were vain, vain Epicurus' schemes,
line_2: "Their systems false, delusive were their dreams:

line_1: Envied Ambition! what are all thy schemes,
line_2: But waking misery, or pleasing dreams,

line_1: No! ne plus ultra bounds her schemes;
line_2: Her fancy of no limits dreams,

line_1: Then ridicul'd his rural schemes,
line_2: His pastoral shades, and purling streams;

line_1: Or deep engross'd in mighty schemes,
line_2: Toss'd in ambition's empty dreams,

line_1: Shall they with dark invafive schemes
line_2: (The mere result of idle dreams)

line_1: Than Low-church politicks with High-church schemes.
line_2: Not more extravagant are drunkards dreams,

line_1: His hair-breadth 'scapes, and all his daring schemes,
line_2: Transport them, and are made their fav'rite themes.

line_1: Paid the following Schemes,
line_2: Of all who it seems

line_1: Let Mecca tell, big with aspiring schemes,
line_2: Seraphic trances, counterfeited dreams,

line_1: Youth's vain rash hopes, and Interest's fordid schemes,
line_2: Blest, if still free from mad Ambition's dreams,
